otter.service package¶

Submodules¶

otter.service.build module¶

otter.service.build.main(args, conn=None, close_conn=True)¶
otter.service.build.write_assignment_info(assignment_id, class_id, assignment_name, seed, conn)¶
Inserts/Updates assignment class_id and assignment_name in database. Inserts if assignment_id

is not present. Updates if assignment_id is present.

Parameters

  • assignment_id (str) – Assignment id which will be created or updated

  • class_id (str) – Class id to insert/update

  • assignment_name (str) – Assignment name to insert/update

  • conn (Connection) – Connection object for database

otter.service.build.write_class_info(class_id, class_name, conn)¶

Writes the given class_name to the database, auto-generating a class_id

Parameters

  • class_name (str) – Name of new class to add to the database

  • conn (Connection) – Connection object for database

Returns

Class ID for newly added class.

Return type

class_id

otter.service.create module¶

otter.service.create.create_users(filepath, host=None, username=None, password=None, conn=None)¶

Inserts usernames from filepath into db

Parameters

  • filepath (str) – Path to CSV files with usernames in first column, passwords in second

  • host (str, optional) – Hostname where postgresql is running

  • username (str, optional) – Username for writing to postgres database

  • password (str, optional) – Password corresponding to provided username

otter.service.create.main(args, conn=None, close_conn=True)¶

conn is arg to pre-made db connection

otter.service.create.remove_users(filepath, host=None, username=None, password=None, conn=None)¶

Removes users specified in file FILEPATH

Parameters

  • filepath (str) – Path to CSV files with usernames in first column, passwords in second

  • host (str, optional) – Hostname where postgresql is running

  • username (str, optional) – Username for writing to postgres database

  • password (str, optional) – Password corresponding to provided username

otter.service.start module¶

class otter.service.start.Application¶

Bases: tornado.web.Application

class otter.service.start.BaseHandler(application, request, **kwargs)¶

Bases: tornado.web.RequestHandler

Base login handler

get_current_user()¶

Gets secure user cookie for personal authentication

class otter.service.start.GoogleOAuth2LoginHandler(application, request, **kwargs)¶

Bases: tornado.web.RequestHandler, tornado.auth.GoogleOAuth2Mixin

property db¶
async get()¶

Google OAuth login handler

Handler for authenticating users with Google OAuth. Requires that user sets environment variables containing their client key and secret. Provides users with an API key that they can enter in the notebook by way of authenticating.

class otter.service.start.LoginHandler(application, request, **kwargs)¶

Bases: otter.service.start.BaseHandler

Default auth handler

A login handler that requires instructors to setup users and passwords in database beforehand, allowing students to auth within the notebook.

property db¶
async get()¶

Get request for personal/default authentication login

class otter.service.start.SubmissionHandler(application, request, **kwargs)¶

Bases: tornado.web.RequestHandler

Processes and validations student submission

Handler for processing and validating a student’s submission. Ensure that notebook is present and valid, checks API key, and implements rate limiting to prevent spamming the autograder. Queues submission for grading by EXECUTOR.

property db¶
async get()¶

Route to warn users that this is a POST-only route

async post()¶

Post request function for handling python notebook submissions

async submit(notebook, api_key)¶
If valid submission, inserts notebook into submissions table in database and queues

it for grading.

Parameters

  • notebook (json) – notebook in json form

  • api_key (str) – API Key generated during submission

async validate(notebook, api_key)¶

Ensures a submision is valid by checking user credentials, submission frequency, and validity of notebook file.

Parameters

  • notebook (json) – notebook in json form

  • api_key (str) – API Key generated during submission

Returns

submission information

Return type

tuple

write_error(status_code, **kwargs)¶

Override to implement custom error pages.

write_error may call write, render, set_header, etc to produce output as usual.

If this error was caused by an uncaught exception (including HTTPError), an exc_info triple will be available as kwargs["exc_info"]. Note that this exception may not be the “current” exception for purposes of methods like sys.exc_info() or traceback.format_exc.

otter.service.start.grade_submission(submission_id)¶

Grades a single submission with id SUBMISSION_ID

Parameters

submission_id (str) – the id of the submission to grade

Returns

grading message and results dataframe for printing

Return type

tuple

otter.service.start.main(cli_args)¶
async otter.service.start.start_grading_queue(shutdown=False)¶

Pops submission ids off SUBMISSION_QUEUE and sending them into EXECUTOR to be graded

Parameters

shutdown (bool) – default False; whether or not to shutdown EXECUTOR after processing queue
